pullRequest.title: [Bug] Fix bug that delete stmt with filter condition delete all data from table on segment v2

commit.message:
Fix bug that delete stmt with filter condition delete all data from table on segment v2
   When we get different columns's row ranges by column_delete_conditions, we should use union operation instead of intersection operation to get final get final row ranges.

Fix bug that delete stmt with filter condition delete all data from table on segment v2
   When we get different columns's row ranges by column_delete_conditions, we should use union operation instead of intersection operation to get final get final row ranges.

commit.message:
[Bug] Fix bug that delete stmt with filter condition delete all data from table on segment v2

The root cause is that we lost the relationship of the two delete conditions in same delete stmt.
Base data:
    k1, k2
    1,  2
    1,  3
case 1:
   delete from tbl where k1=1 and k2=2;
case 2:
   delete from tbl where k1=1;
   delete from tbl where k2=2;

We treat the above 2 cases as same, which is incorrect.
So we need to process every rowset of delete conditions separately.

Revert commit for log to remove unused log

This reverts commit e56dabb1a1ceb0c1120f9cd3d260f58c741562fb.
Add docs/contents and be/build_Release to .gitignore file

afterCommit.message: Add docs/contents and be/build_Release to .gitignore file

nodes.bodyText:
Should the column_cond be null here?
We already filter the data by column conditions before.

_opts.conditions may be nullptr here.
You need to check it before use, like the old way.

commit.message: fix core caused by null conditions of opts
